business.headline: Skipped filing ITR? You may get a tax notice very soonThe tax authorities use a risk management strategy (RMS) to flag high-risk non-filers, said the department.  This system looks at high-value transactions (property purchases, large bank deposits, etc.), income from salary, rent, mutual funds, and shares, etc.

IndusInd Bank share crash: Should you buy as stock falls 22% today?The decline in IndusInd Bank share price came after the bank, in an internal review of its derivative portfolio, found discrepancies that could reduce its net worth by an estimated 2.35%. This amounts to an impact of nearly Rs 1,577 crore.

US recession: Is it a possibility or just a Wall Street worry?The massive sell-off on Wall Street was triggered by Donald Trump's recent remark on the possibility of a US recession in 2025. But is a US recession actually looming?

IndusInd Bank shares crash 21% to hit 52-week low. Why is it falling today?IndusInd Bank stock price fall: IndusInd Bank's stock has lost nearly 50% in the past six months, with a 32% decline in the last four weeks alone. The stock fell nearly 4% to Rs 900.50 on the NSE in the previous session.

Sensex down nearly 400 points: Why is the stock market falling today? The Sensex fell nearly 400 points, while the Nifty dropped over 100 points as investors reacted to growing concerns about a possible recession in the US, along with a sharp fall in IT stocks.

Sensex, Nifty fall as US market crash rattles investors; IndusInd Bank down 10%The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 361.25 points to 73,753.92, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 113.65 points to 22,346.65 as of 9:16 AM.

Sensex, Nifty eye shaky opening as Wall Street crash spooks global marketsUS stock markets saw their biggest single-day fall since 2022 on Monday, March 10. The S&P 500 and Nasdaq crashed by up to 4%, while the Dow Jones dropped 2.08%.

IndusInd Bank shares in focus after Rs 1,577 crore networth hit riskThe stock fell nearly 4% to Rs 900.50 on the NSE in the previous session. IndusInd Bank's stock has lost more than 37% in the past six months, with a 16% decline in the last four weeks alone.

Tesla shares tumble almost 16% as US stock markets crashTesla shares plunged 15.4 per cent to USD 222.15 on Monday, their lowest since October, amid investor pessimism over slumping sales and Trump administration trade policy uncertainty. It was Tesla's steepest drop since September 2020.

Trump tariffs, recession fears slam US markets, wiping out $4 trillion in valueDonald Trump's tariffs have rattled investors, wiping out USD 4 trillion from the S&P 500 as trade uncertainty with Canada, Mexico, and China grows.

US stocks fall sharply as recession fears grow; Nasdaq down 4%US stocks fell sharply as concerns over tariffs and a potential government shutdown fuelled recession fears. The S&P 500 had its worst one-day drop since December, falling 2.7%, while the Nasdaq dropped 4%, confirming a correction.

Wall Street sell-off worsens on Trump tariffs, recession worriesEuropean markets have already taken a hit, and Asian markets are unlikely to be spared. Dalal Street is likely in for a rough session on Tuesday, especially information technology (IT) stocks that rely on the US for business.

entertainment.headline: KKK 14's Aditi Sharma heads for divorce, husband alleges infidelity in 4 monthsTV actor Aditi Sharma's marital bliss was short-lived as her husband Abhineet Kaushik accused her of cheating. This comes just four months after their secret wedding on November 12, 2024.

Mallika Sherawat in talks for Khatron Ke Khiladi 15: ReportMallika Sherawat is reportedly in talks for Khatron Ke Khiladi 15. While her participation isn't confirmed, she recently returned to Bollywood and is now looking for her next big project.

Singer Isabel LaRosa on performing at Lolla India: The experience was surrealIsabel LaRosa, known for hits like Favourite and I'm Yours, recently performed at Lollapalooza India. She discussed her music-making process and experience with India Today Digital.

Dhanashree Verma restores photos with Yuzvendra Chahal amid rumours of divorceDhanashree Verma restored Instagram photos with Yuzvendra Chahal amid divorce rumours. While her lawyer confirmed court proceedings, her family denied claims of a Rs 60 crore alimony demand.

Udit Narayan mocks the kiss row at 'Pintu Ki Pappi' eventVeteran playback singer Udit Narayan opened up about the viral kiss incident a month after backlash. He discussed the timeline of the video where he is seen kissing his female fans.

Ashish Chanchlani makes public appearance after India's Got Latent row. WatchContent creator Ashish Chanchlani made a rare public appearance in Mumbai amid controversy surrounding Ranveer Allahbadia's comment on India's Got Latent.

Watch: Hip Hop India 2 trailer promises to raise intensity, higher the stakesHip Hop India, the country's hip-hop dance reality show, is set to return for its second season on Amazon MX Player, promising even more thrilling performances and intense dance battles.

You 5 trailer: Penn Badgeley's Joe Goldberg returns for a killer finaleThe trailer for You Season 5 is out, showcasing the last chapter of Joe Goldberg's saga. Streaming starts April 24 on Netflix, with Joe facing past demons.
South Korean singer Wheesung found dead at 43Popular South Korean soloist Wheesung was found dead at his home on Monday. The authorities are still investigating the matter.

Meghan Markle's father criticises her show, mocks her for putting flowers on food Meghan Markle's estranged father, Thomas Markle, talked about her Netflix show, 'With Love, Meghan', in an interview. He called her 'fake', and mentioned that she should have had a more relatable show for women who are not privileged like her.

Surreal and magical: Singer Lisa Mishra on sharing stage with Ed SheeranSinger Lisa Mishra performed the opening act for British singer Ed Sheeran during his concert in India earlier this year. Speaking exclusively to India Today Digital, the 31-year-old reflected on her experience of the same. Additionally, she opened up about working with Ananya Panday in Call Me Bae.

Badshah's weight-loss video stuns fans, internet thinks he looks like AP DhillonA recent video of Badshah has left fans stunned by his physical transformation. While promoting his new clothing brand, he showcased his new look, prompting fans to compare him to fellow Punjabi singer and rapper AP Dhillon.

When Life Gives You Tangerines review:  IU, Park Bo-gum's series is a must-watchReleased-Fri Mar 07, 2025In When Life Gives You Tangerines, IU and Park Bo-gum deliver mesmerising performances in a story that spans decades. Set against the backdrop of 1960s Jeju, this K-drama explores themes of love, endurance, and the quiet strength of women.

Actor Helly Shah on TV's future: We need to up our gameActor Helly Shah talks about her comedy debut, TV's regressive content, and her Bollywood aspirations. She also shares that she dreams of playing bold and tough roles.

Lollapalooza Day 2: Green Day, Louis Tomlinson, Aurora make thunderous India debutMumbai's Mahalaxmi Racecourse became the epicentre of music as Lollapalooza India 2025 wrapped up Day 2. From Green Day's electrifying debut to indie rock and soulful serenades, it was a night of musical magic.

Suits LA: Harvey Spector lands on the West Coast, throws some sass at Ted BlackIn the new promo of 'Suits LA', Harvey Spector is finally seen interacting with Ted Black. Actor Gabriel Macht will be joining the show for a three-episode arc.

Exclusive: How Shawn Mendes collaborated with Indian sitarist for Lolla India setSinger Shawn Mendes collaborated with sitarist Megha Rawoot for Day 1 for Lollapalooza India. In an exclusive interview with Megha Rawoot, she spoke about her performance.

Security sought for Rashmika Mandanna after MLA's 'teach her a lesson' remarkAn association seeking rights for natives of Karnataka's Coorg (Kodagu) region, Codava National Council, urged the state authorities to provide security for actor Rashmika Mandanna. According to the council, the actor was being unfairly targeted after Congress MLA Ravi Ganiga claimed she refused to attend a Kannada film industry event.

Shankar Mahadevan remembers 'guiding light' Zakir Hussain on birth anniversaryIt was legendary tabla maestro Zakir Hussain's 74th birth anniversary on Sunday. Marking the occasion, singer and composer Shankar Mahadevan honoured him with heartfelt birthday wishes on social media.

Lady Gaga recalls psychosis diagnosis and how she felt 'ashamed' to talk about itIn an interview, singer Lady Gaga discussed her personal struggles that kept her away from music. She shared insights into her mental health journey, being diagnosed with psychosis and the support from her partner, Michael Polansky.

The Last of Us 2 trailer: Pedro Pascal and Bella Ramsey promise thrilling returnThe first full trailer of The Last of Us Season 2 is here. Starring Pedro Pascal and Bella Ramsey in lead roles, the HBO Max series promises a bigger and better season.

Lollapalooza India Day 1: Shawn Mendes must return for a solo concert in IndiaThe first day of Lollapalooza India 2025 kicked off on a grand note with Canadian singer Shawn Mendes' electrifying performance. The show also witnessed performances by several Indian artists, like Jonita Gandhi and Divine among others.

Shawn Mendes honours Virat Kohli, wears Team India jersey at Mumbai show. WatchSinger Shawn Mendes impressed fans with his debut India performance on March 8 at the Lollapalooza Mumbai show. During the concert, the singer delighted fans by wearing Virat Kohli's Team India jersey.

Viral: Shawn Mendes sings Senorita on Mumbai street ahead of concertCanadian singer Shawn Mendes, who is currently in India, performed his hit song Senorita on a Mumbai street on Saturday, much to the delight of his fans.

Zahan Kapoor reflects on celebrityhood, Kapoor legacy and Black Warrant's successActor Zahan Kapoor opened up about his career, his latest Netflix show, Black Warrant, his famous cousins, and more, at the India Today Conclave 2025 held in New Delhi on Saturday.

Mindy Kaling reacts to criticism of Meghan Markle's With Love, MeghanActor and creator Mindy Kaling has finally reacted to the criticism of Meghan Markle's lifestyle series, With Love, Meghan. The show premiered on Netflix on March 4.

The Electric State review: Russo Brothers' dystopian film sparks and fizzles outReleased-Fri Mar 14, 2025The Netflix film, 'The Electric State' falls short of entertainment. The chemistry between Millie Bobbie Brown and Chris Pratt looks awkward, while the bots don't do enough to keep the excitement alive.

Nadaaniyan X reviews: Internet shreds Ibrahim-Khushi's film, calls it trashyNadaaniyan, starring Ibrahim Ali Khan and Khushi Kapoor, debuts on Netflix to widespread criticism, with viewers and critics alike branding it 'unbearable' and 'trashy'.

Ruby review: A debut album that's ambitious, polished, and unapologetically Jennie Blackpink's Jennie's debut solo album, Ruby, is a bold exploration of her musical identity, featuring 15 tracks that delve into themes of empowerment and self-discovery.

Meghan Markle's With Love, Meghan renewed for season 2 amid criticismThe Duchess of Sussex, Meghan Markle, has announced a second season of her Netflix series, With Love, Meghan. The show premiered on the OTT giant on March 4.

Mobland trailer: Tom Hardy, Pierce Brosnan headline Guy Ritchie's new crime showMobland, the much-awaited crime series by Guy Ritchie, is all set for its grand premiere on JioHotstar this March. Featuring stars like Tom Hardy and Helen Mirren, the show explores the dark world of international crime syndicates.

Rishab Sharma on popularising Sitar, starting his own clothing brandRenowned 26-year-old sitar player Rishab Rikhiram Sharma blends classical and modern music. Trained under Ravi Shankar, he performs globally, including at the White House. Known for his mehendi-adorned hands, he also creates music for mental health.

What Rick Hoffman's entry as Louis Litt means for Suits LAActor Rick Hoffman will be reprising his iconic character, Louis Litt, from 'Suits', in one of the upcoming episodes of 'Suits LA'. The news comes days after the show received bad reviews for lacking excitement like the original one.

Why sitarist Rishab Sharma wears mehndi for every performanceSitarist Rishab Sharma embraces mehndi as part of his stage presence, blending tradition with innovation. The young sitarist shares how he enhances performance aesthetics while breaking stereotypes.

Sitarist Rishab Sharma: Said no to performing at White House initiallyRenowned sitarist and internet sensation Rishab Sharma opened up about performing at the White House, choosing the sitar over guitar, and more, during his appearance at India Today Conclave 2025 in New Delhi on Friday.

Shabana Azmi says Shibani Akhtar 'pulled her by the ear' to join Dabba CartelShabana Azmi revealed at the India Today Conclave 2025 that Shibani Akhtar "pulled her by the ear" to make her join Dabba Cartel. Shibani always envisioned her as part of the series.

general news.headline: Hotelier's grandson arrested in gold smuggling case, was friends with Ranya RaoThe DRI has arrested Tarun Raju, grandson of Atria Hotel's owner, in Bengaluru for his alleged role in the gold smuggling case linked to actor Ranya Rao, sources said. His arrest follows Rao's recent detention with gold worth Rs 12.56 crore.

Stalin's anti-Hindi stand gets troll treatment with 'Yappa Yappa Stalin Appa'Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin is facing an unusual wave of trolling over his stand against the "Hindi imposition". The BJP seized the moment to highlight what they call DMK's hypocrisy on the three-language policy.

When Modi visited 'Mini India' Mauritius 27 years agoPM Modi in Mauritius: Known as 'mini India' due to its large Indian-origin population, Mauritius holds a special place in PM Modi's heart. The connection dates back 27 years, when Modi first went to Mauritius to address the Ramayana Conference.

Chandigarh crash: 1 killed, scooter split in two after being dragged by PorscheA speeding Porsche allegedly hit two scooters in Chandigarh's Sector 4, killing one man and injuring two women. The impact of the collision was such that the scooter rider's body was cut into two peices.

Kerala girl dies after water fasting: What extreme weight-loss diets do to the bodyAn 18-year-old girl from Kerala tragically died from anorexia after following extreme water fasting inspired by online portals. Experts warn against crash diets and prolonged fasting, citing severe health risks.

Elon Musk alleges Ukraine link in X cyberattack that caused global outageElon Musk's X suffered repeated outages Monday, which he blamed on a "massive cyberattack" from the "Ukraine area". However, a pro-Palestinian hacker group has claimed responsibility for the attack, raising questions about the true source of the disruption.

She denied claims of a U-turn by the state government and MPs.

This city's air is the most polluted in India. It's not DelhiThirteen of the world's top 20 most polluted cities are in India, with Byrnihat in Assam topping the list. Delhi, however, remains the most polluted capital city globally.

sports.headline: No Shakib, Mahmudullah opts out as BCB reveal 2025 central contract listShakib Al Hasan was overlooked as Mahmudullah decided to opt out of the Bangladesh Cricket Board's central contract list for 2025. Taskin Ahmed was the only player to be given the Grade A+ contract.

Some Manchester United players not 'good enough', some 'overpaid': Jim RatcliffeManchester United co-owner Jim Ratcliffe has delivered a damning verdict on the current squad, saying some of the players are not 'good enough'. Ratcliffe also gave his backing to current manager Ruben Amorim.

Watch: After Champions Trophy win, Ravindra Jadeja joins CSK in 'Pushpa' styleAfter helping India win the Champions Trophy, Ravindra Jadeja arrived at the Chennai Super Kings team base with some 'Pushpa' swag on Monday, March 10. Jadeja will be a key player for Chennai this season.

Sports Ministry revokes suspension of Wrestling Federation of India The Sports Ministry has revoked the suspension of the Wrestling Federation of India (WFI). Back in December 2023, the Ministry had suspended the WFI over taking hasty decision and showing disregard for the existing rules and regulations.

Following their win, MI have a great chance of finishing at the top on points table and directly qualify for the final.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
